thread.title: Michael Sukkar tells property buyers get a highly paid job | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Michael Sukkar tells property buyers get a highly paid job | Daily Mail Online

author: Freya Noble For Daily Mail Australia
title: Michael Sukkar tells property buyers get a highly paid job | Daily Mail Online
text: comments The Federal MP charged with tackling Australia's housing affordability crisis has said the 'first step' to owning a home is a getting a 'highly paid job'. During an interview with Sky News on Monday night, Assistant Minister to the Treasurer Michael Sukkar was discussing the the tough property market. When asked what solutions the government had in place to assist struggling prospective homeowners, he suggested people trying to crack the market earn more money. Scroll down for video Assistant Minister to the Treasurer Michael Sukkar has suggested young Australians trying to crack the housing market should get a 'highly paying' job 'We're also enabling young people to get highly paid jobs which is the first step to buying a house, it's not the only answer but it's the first step,' Mr Sukkar told Sky News. The Victorian MP went on to say that he left university part-way through his degree, 'got a great start and I was able to forge a career', and owned two properties by the time he was 35.
